channel.title: NPR Topics: Technology
channel.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says talk with China's Xi yielded progress, including on TikTok
item.description: Officials have been working on a deal to bring popular video app TikTok under U.S. ownership to avoid shutting it down in the United States.
item.content:encoded:
Officials have been working on a deal to bring popular video app TikTok under U.S. ownership to avoid shutting it down in the United States.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Their teenage sons died by suicide. Now, they are sounding an alarm about AI chatbots
item.description: Grieving parents and online safety advocates at a congressional hearing called for new laws to regulate AI companion apps to protect the mental health of minors.
item.content:encoded:
Grieving parents and online safety advocates at a congressional hearing called for new laws to regulate AI companion apps to protect the mental health of minors.

(Image credit: Screenshot via Senate Judiciary Committee)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: A judge ordered Google to share its search data. What does that mean for user privacy?
item.description: The ruling in the Google antitrust trial has led to a host of hard-to-answer questions about the future of Google's search data, which the tech giant must now share with competitors. What does that mean for users' data privacy?
item.content:encoded:
The ruling in the Google antitrust trial has led to a host of hard-to-answer questions about the future of Google's search data, which the tech giant must now share with competitors. What does that mean for users' data privacy?

(Image credit: Don Ryan/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Kirk shooting videos spread online, even to viewers who didn't want to see them
item.description: Graphic videos of the Charlie Kirk shooting spread widely online, raising concerns over the emotional and political toll of exposure to violent imagery.
item.content:encoded:
Graphic videos of the Charlie Kirk shooting spread widely online, raising concerns over the emotional and political toll of exposure to violent imagery.

(Image credit: Michael Ciaglo)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: What does the Google antitrust ruling mean for the future of AI?
item.description: A federal judge's mild ruling in the Justice Department's suit over Google's search engine monopoly has critics worried that the tech giant can now monopolize artificial intelligence.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge's mild ruling in the Justice Department's suit over Google's search engine monopoly has critics worried that the tech giant can now monopolize artificial intelligence.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Foreign influencers are doing their best to spin the Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Russia, Iran and China have all attempted to shape the narrative, but so far, their influence has been relatively minor, experts say.
item.content:encoded:
Russia, Iran and China have all attempted to shape the narrative, but so far, their influence has been relatively minor, experts say.

(Image credit: Jesse Bedayn)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Trump extends TikTok reprieve as deal nears
item.description: While legally questionable, the extension comes just as it appears China and the U.S. may finally have a deal on TikTok's fate.
item.content:encoded:
While legally questionable, the extension comes just as it appears China and the U.S. may finally have a deal on TikTok's fate.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Officials announce a 'framework' for keeping TikTok online in the U.S.
item.description: U.S. officials have announced a "framework" that would let Chinese-owned short video platform TikTok continue operations in the United States, although the two countries are still working out the details.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. officials have announced a "framework" that would let Chinese-owned short video platform TikTok continue operations in the United States, although the two countries are still working out the details.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Why parents need to talk to their teens about AI — and how to start the conversation
item.description: Many teens are using artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT for everything from homework to relationship advice. Experts say parents must lead the way in helping them understand the technology.
item.content:encoded:
Many teens are using artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT for everything from homework to relationship advice. Experts say parents must lead the way in helping them understand the technology.

(Image credit: Eva Redamonti for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Lee V. Gaines

item.title: A play about the revolt of human workers — not machines — gave us the word 'robot'
item.description: A Czech playwright introduced the word to English in the 1920s. But back then, it wasn't analogous to machinery. New interpretations of the robot reflect a modernity once skewered by the writer.
item.content:encoded:
A Czech playwright introduced the word to English in the 1920s. But back then, it wasn't analogous to machinery. New interpretations of the robot reflect a modernity once skewered by the writer.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
